fields.summary: Provide an option to show the location attribute in the Team Calendars

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-50249].
  {panel}

Customer would like to have an option to copy from an existing calendar. 

Here's an example of how this would benefit customers:
Say we have a team calendar for Spring-Summer 2013, ideally we can create Spring Summer 2014 from the previous season. Manually re-keying would be a huge no-no.

h5. Workaround:
Export the calendar and re-import it back to Confluence with a different Calendar name.
fields.summary: To Include 'Copy From' Calendar Option
Creation Date and Creator in the Existing Calendar List.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-50247].
  {panel}

h4. Steps to Reproduce
# Ensure that there are two or more calendars
# Create a new event
# Fill all the fields and ensure that the options are changed (so that they are different from the default values/options)
# Once every fields are filled, change the calendar name

h4. Expected Results
All values for each field should stay the same

h4. Actual Results
Before changing the calendar name:
!screenshot001.jpg!

After changing the calendar name:
!screenshot002.jpg!

Notice that the values for "What", "When", and "All day event" are changed/cleared. The other fields are not changed.

h4. Recommendation
Team Calendars should not delete/clear any fields to change them to default. This is to *prevent* users from entering the same data in case they choose the wrong calendar
fields.summary: Automatically keep event details if a user changes the event type or calendar

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-50246].
  {panel}

Twice now I've added an event to the "Atlassian Company Events" calendar because it starts with "A".

I added an event on our team calendars team calendar for David, hit save.
Then I pressed add again to add another one for me... and didn't even read the calendar name.. very annoying..

Is this a quick win? Maybe one for the VN team? Even if it's local storage
fields.summary: Remember my last Calendar name and event type selection
If a date appears on a Confluence viewpage, integrate team calendars so you can see dates around that event or create an event from that date
Add the ability to customise colours for resolved JIRA issues, or to toggle fading on resolved colours.
Ability to expand events in the list view to view all events

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-50240].
  {panel}

*Current:*
* When User hover on truncated URL it's NOT shows the full URL on a tool-tip.

*Expected:*
* When User hover on truncated URL it should show the full URL on a tool-tip.

_Notes:_
_it related to TEAMCAL-298 and TEAMCAL-1608_
fields.summary: Linked page should show tooltip when User hover on truncated URL
Allow creation of events that repeat on specific days
Show current event in user profile/user hover
Allow user to edit event for future instance
URL or hyperlinks displayed in event's description field should be clickable

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-50234].
  {panel}

We have an excel spreadsheet to convey information on the con-current sprints running in our organisation.

I was looking to migrate to Team Calendar, except there is one flaw blocking this. Our concurrent agile sprints display well. When I tried to capture capture planned deployment events (of type event), in the timeline view, these were placed in random locations, not related to the sprints.

Where as in the excel spreadsheet, we can add these to the same row, and use different colours to represent the different stages.

What I would like is an event type of 'deployment' which can be linked to a sprint, or to a 'version', which will be displayed on the same row in timeline view. 

| Sprint X ---- |-- GoToUAT -- | -- Golive -- | | | |
|  | Sprint Y ---- | -- GoToUAT -- | -- Golive -- | | |
|  |  |  | Sprint Z ---- | -- GoToUAT -- | -- Golive -- |
fields.summary: As a manager, I want to link events, so that I can see related events on a single line in the timeline view

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-50233].
  {panel}

On this page there are 3 event macros. They all have the same value for the ID. This means that clicking the 'Attend' button does not work.

I suspect this was caused by the page author copy/pasting the macro. There is no indication to the author that the mistake has been made. Either:
# The macro should recognise the duplicate ID values and show an error on page view
# The macro should generate a new value for ID when it is copy/pasted
fields.summary: Should not be able to create Event macros with duplicate IDs
Autosize in Timeline View
Remove Team Calendar Dependency on Language Pack

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-50230].
  {panel}

As a Confluence Admin (and former Technical Writer) I need the Team Calendar user documentation to be much more detailed (almost to the point of the excellent Confluence User Guide) to enable me to use Team Calendars well and most importantly sell the feature to users in my organisation. We cannot get user buy-in when the supporting documentation is 
seemingly half finished.
______________

Additional information: I am really disappointed in the quality of the Team Calendars user documentation and find it exasperating to only ever find clear answers by trawling through other users comments to establish the full limits and limitations of Team Calendars.

A couple of examples: 

1. The only way I ever found out that you could not change colours of events / have multiple different events split by colour was from other user experiences.. Sadly this is one of many similar situations I have faced and ultimately is seen as a blocker for expanding team calendar usage across my organisation. 

2. The inherent difficulty in working with calendars is well known however as a user who may be looking to purchase your product I would hope that there would be more information relating to Subscribing to and Exporting team calendars. Not every confluence user is a master of this and the existing information on the following pages is not enough. Nothing is ever mentioned about receiving notifications in Outlook for upcoming events or what happens if I change my event in Team Calendars (or Outlook) - is it auto updated in the other tool? Basically, simple functional information is missing or at least highly unclear.

The product is not your average plugin (content and price wise) but a lot more than that and it deserves the right level of accompanying user documentation
fields.summary: Improve Team Calendars User Documentation
Ability to see or find who created a event calendar
Event dialog is not nice in IE8

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-50227].
  {panel}

We are a startup and our events have various compositions of attendance. Sometimes the founders meet, sometimes devs, sometimes marketing plus individual devs, etc.
Now we don't want to create one dedicated calendar for each possible meeting composition, just in order to separate concerns.

Thus, as a user, I would much appreciate the ability to filter my calendar view and subscriptions (e.g. Google Calendar) to only include those events that I am attending (i.e. I am in the "Who" list). It's like a selective/filtered watch or subscribe.

In connection with the possibly planned RSVP functionality, the filter would be events that I did not reject (RSVP: Not attending).

In addition, it would be nice to be able to subscribe to only a subset of event types in a calendar.
fields.summary: Display and subscribe only events I attend

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-50225].
  {panel}

I love the switch from calendar types to event types.  Unfortunately it still leaves a challenge we have that still forces me to update multiple calendars.  We all work on multiple project teams and also on a single HR team.  It would be a crazy calendar if I put all projects and hr calendars together since it would include way more users and entries than needed.

How about the ability to 'subscribe and scope' to one or many calendars?

Example:
User ABC is on Project X, Project Y and Project Z and reports to HRDepartment 123
I have Project X, Project Y, Project Z and HRDepartment 123 Team Calendars

I place all my Travel/Leave/Birthday entries on HRDepartment 123 calendar.

From Project X, I can just subcribe to HRDepartment 123 and scope it to User ABC to pull User ABC's entries to include for that project. . . Negating the need for User ABC to have to enter those events 4 times.
fields.summary: Pull configured user specific calendar entries from other Team Calendars
Ability to edit JIRA Sprint Calendar (currently automatic)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-50222].
  {panel}

Hi,

Currently the permission to delete the responses on Event macros is tied to the "edit page" restriction. We think it makes more sense if only the people that have delete permission on the page would have the permission to delete responses. Only the "Space Admins" and "Confluence Admins" keep the "Remove pages" permission in our Confluence instance and we would like to keep the same permission for deleting the responses for events as well. Just our feedback. No big deal if you guys don't agree:)

Thanks
Adhip
fields.summary: Delete option should take the permisison of "delete" pages not "edit" pages

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-50221].
  {panel}

*Steps:*
* Delete an event issue (single or series issue)

*Actual:*
* There is nothing happen (on the GUI) until it done

*Suggestion:*
* Rename "Yes" to "Delete"
* When the user presses "Delete", the button should go into a disabled state
Examples: See what happens when you preview a page, or add restrictions in restriction dialog
fields.summary: After pressing "yes" in the "Delete Event" dialog, we should provide some visual feedback to indicate this is happening
Recommend email updates includes Leave events.
TeamCal ICS Caused Multiple Invitations Send After it was Imported
Option in Team Calendars macro to only display specific event types

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-50217].
  {panel}

Hi,

We would like to request to have the "Edit" option on "Event" macro. Currently, if you make any mistake ( by accident), the only way to change that is to delete the response and add another response. This is not a huge deal to do but we thought having the edit option to correct your response sounds more reasonable. Only the responder should have that option though not everyone.

Thanks
Adhip
fields.summary: "Edit" option on "Event" Macro
Replace group picker pop-up window and merge it into a user and group picker in the restrictions dialog

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-50215].
  {panel}

*Current*
* User exports a Team Calendar Macro page to pdf file
* => PDF file does not show Team Calendar
 
*Expected*
* It should be better if Team Calendar Macro supports export to PDF file

!Screen Shot 2013-12-11 at 2.24.01 PM.png!
!Screen Shot 2013-12-11 at 2.24.31 PM.png!
fields.summary: Exporting calendar as PDF or Word document

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-50214].
  {panel}

In evaluating Team Calendars for our confluence instance I was very excited to see the option to import JIRA versions into the calendar. I even found a reference to this feature in another improvement  https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/TEAMCAL-417 however, when I tied it out it did not work for me.

What I want to do is using the "Start Date" and "Release Date" in jira for versions have that show up as a range bar in Team Calendars. Today only the Release Date shows up. 

I was told that this can be done via Agile which I tested and found it could do this. In addition to that I found that creating a custom issue type can do the same. However, I pefer and I think it is beneficial to users if there was only one place in JIRA to update a versions dates. In both the Agile and the issue type workaround a user would have to update the dates in more then one location. If this feature were implemented not only would users not "have to" buy Agile but it can be administered in one location in JIRA.

It seem fairly straight forward that the fields are in JIRA already and the functionality of Team Calendars is there but the option to put these together is lacking.
fields.summary: Show date range of JIRA versions

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-50213].
  {panel}

HI,
I think it would be great and really useful to have an option for the user to define how far zoomed in they would like to start out with in the Timeline view for team calendars.

For example: today, this week, this month, three months

It is really tedious for me to have to zoom in to the current day every time I load the page.

Thank you and I hope this gets added into the next update!
fields.summary: Remember the last zoom setting for a particular user

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-50212].
  {panel}

The birthday event type seems to lazily re-use the controls from other event types, even when it doesn't quite make sense.

Among the inputs that I don't think are needed:
* End date, because generally people don't have birthdays spanning multiple days (unless people born on Feb 29 need to do a span from Feb 28 to March 1?)
* All day event (it's implied)
* Repeat / Repeat every / Ends (who doesn't have a repeating birthday?)
fields.summary: Team Calendars: "Birthday" event UI could be smarter

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-50211].
  {panel}

h2. Background of Request

[Team Calendar release version 3.1|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/TEAMCAL/Team+Calendars+3.1+Release+Notes] change Team Calendar behavior in regards to JIRA integration.

Since release version 3.1, Team Calendar will "[greyed out|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/TEAMCAL/Team+Calendars+3.1+Release+Notes#TeamCalendars3.1ReleaseNotes-Easilyidentifycompletedissuesandreleases]" any completed task to make it easier to identify.

However some user could find this annoying as they are unable to read the ticket title in a glance. 

h2. Proposed Solution

It would be great if we could provide an option to the customer to disable such feature. This way, customer can choose not to use the new feature provided on the latest release without feeling force to use it when they prefer not to have the new feature.
fields.summary: Provide The Ability to Disabled "Greyed Out" Completed Ticket

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-50210].
  {panel}

[~vvo] I've been using this on PUG a bit and I think we need to tweak the wording. If the release has already passed, this wording doesn't make sense:
!http://cl.ly/image/2b09182s2n1P/Image%202013.11.04%208%3A48%3A06%20AM.png!
 because the release has already shipped.

Can I suggest the following:
1. If the release is coming up (the current date < release date) the wording stays the same as what it is today
2. If the release date has passed and the version is not released, we keep the same wording
3. If the date has passed AND the version is released - we change the wording to be the date by it'self. So "Due 3 days ago" changes to "12 Aug, 2013" 

We already have knowledge if a version has been released or not because we show a different icon if it is released
fields.summary: [JIRA Version] It should change the wording to be the date by itself.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-50208].
  {panel}

*Preconditions:*
* Open Team Calendar in confluence in any Browsers
* Create many events in a month (ex. Nov 2013)

*Steps:*
* 1. Login and Go to My Calendar
* 2. Go to Nov 2013
* => It shows warning message "Some events were not shown in the calendars below because there were too many of them"
* 3. Go to Print Preview (IE, firefox: right click => click print preview; Chrome: Ctrl+P)
* 4. Observe header area

*Actual:*
* Above warning message is shown in preview calendar

*Expected:*
* Above warning message should NOT shown in preview calendar

_Notes:_
* _Please refer to the attached pictures for more detail_
fields.summary: Calendar Printing - Warining message is shown in Print Preview

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-50207].
  {panel}

Step
* Create a calendar by admin
* Subscribe this calendar by a test user
* Admin: restrict this calendar to admin only
* Admin: Create a new event, such as events
* Test: reload page
* => it shows an error message
* Admin: Create a new event, such ad Travels
* Test: reload page
* => it shows more an error message
* Admin: Create a new event, such as Birthday
* Test: reload page
* => it shows more an error message

!Screen Shot 2014-05-13 at 10.05.53 AM.png|thumbnail!

Actual
* Error messages have 3 messages for one calendar

Expected
* Error messages should show 1 message per each Calendar
fields.summary: Error messages should show 1 message per each Calendar
Search experience for existing team calendars is confusing as results are updated
Import calendars in CSV/Excel format
As a user, I would like to have different event types that are color coded
Events Macro

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-50202].
  {panel}

# Browse to the Confluence [dev teams cal|https://pug.jira.com/wiki/calendar/previewcalendar.action?subCalendarId=268d0252-a09d-43f1-a26d-a4ee44bf3a31]
# Click 'Add Event'
# Try to change the month from November to December using the > button

The browser window hangs for a while, and you get a "Uncaught RangeError: Maximum call stack size exceeded" error in the JS console. Same for selecting the previous month.
fields.summary: Clicking 'next' and 'previous' month on date picker in TeamCal causes JS error and doesn't change the month
Ability to customize fields for calendars
Add custom repeat to "Create Event"
Display the Names of Users Associated With Event Types in the Upcoming Events Calendar on the Dashboard

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-50193].
  {panel}

Precondition
* Create a JIRA issue event

Steps
* Edit the JIRA issue
* => It shows Edit Jira issues popup
* Click on OK button while it is loading

Actual
* It shows error message {color:red}"Please select at least one date or date range."{color}

Expected

fields.summary: Edit Jira issues dialog should not allow Users click on OK button while it's loading
Ability to administer calendar notification subscriptions from the Confluence notifications screen
Report by users
Birthday events can have their frequency changed

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-50187].
  {panel}

Hello,

I would like to know if there is a way to have multiple calendars under one heading. For instance, I would have something like:

* Store 1
** Facebook calendar
** Google+ calendar
** Twitter calendar
** Blog calendar

* Store 2
** Facebook calendar
** Google+ calendar
** Twitter calendar
** Blog calendar

All under 1 calendar called "Social Calendar"

I did not see a ticket request for this. Is this level of customization available as of now? If so, how can I go about setting this up?
fields.summary: Multiple Calendar Headers

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-50186].
  {panel}

Currently, any user with 'edit' restrictions can delete any event. 
Feature request is to look at a new restriction so that only events owners and admins can delete events. With other words, anyone with 'edit' restriction can  delete my event and add his event.

We want to use a calendar like a meeting room scheduler. For that we also need a restriction (workaround) for overlapping events and an workaround for autocomplete 'who' field with current user.

Thank you
fields.summary: Restrict Event Delete To Administrators/Event Owner

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-50185].
  {panel}

A macro for embedded stacked calendars in a confluence wiki page would be great.
Meaning I can embed let's say 4 calendar timeline views in a column.

Currently I can do this by including the calendar macro 4 times (e.g. in a table for good alignment), but the result is not fully satisfactory.

The new macro should provide options to:
* link the stacked view to one control synchronized scrolling and zooming
* hide controls on panels of the stacked view 

Picture shows current workaround with multiple includes in a table.
!stacked-calendars.JPG|width=100%!
fields.summary: Team Calendar Macro for stacked calendar views
Support subscription for JIRA Calendar
Ability to change owner of team calendar
Timeline view is not showing in the word/pdf export
Show me the creator of a Team Calendar
Ability to edit team calendars for administrators

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-50174].
  {panel}

1. add event in team calendar
2. Select "Jira Issue Dates" and Event Type.
3. For display select "JQL (advanced)" and enter your JQL string. Use a filter that does not exist in JIRA.
Now the Jira event has been added to my team calendar. But you can not change the filter? You are now stuck with an event in my calendar i no longer want.

_Notes: Please refer to the attached pictures for more detail._

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-50170].

The idea is to create a new kind of team calendar:

new:  news/blog

It would here be usefull to select the news who are displayed ( space: @current, @all, ... or/and with labels ).

Kind regards

Toggle displayed (sub)calendars on a per-page basis
Automatically detect user time zone
Create a note as to which field on the event creation screen is visible on the upcoming events section of Dashboard

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-50163].
  {panel}

*Steps*
* This is the user experience I think we should improve on that
* Business case: I am an event creator, I create a weekly event for my team. However, I pay a lot of work already to change the location for each week event, so week 1 my team can play at pace A, and week 2 at place B.
* When I change my event type, OR any information and click OK, ALL OF MY EVENT is reset to be the same as the event I chose to edit ( For example the place). And so I have to edit the event again. That is really a bad behaviour for end user 

*Actual*
* add texts here

*Expected*
* We should have a checkbox like "Only update the fields I edit". It will ensure that the list of events will only changed on the field user need. Any other field, which is modified for different event will be kept safely.
* Please consider my opinion
fields.summary: When change event type, user is forced to change all the fields in the event for ALL event also

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-50162].
  {panel}

*Preconditions*
* Install confluence 4.2-m2
* Login in with admin, then create an user "qavn"
 
*Step*
* Login with admin user
* Install TeamCalendar 4.2-m4
* Create a calendar and all even types (ex. admin's calendar)
* Logout admin then re-login with *qavn* user
* Add an exist calendar "admin's calendar"
* Select a calendar then click Add button
* Observer the add calendar popup

*Actual*
* There is nothing change (GUI) before it disappear

*Expected*
* The button should go to a "disabled" state when you add a calendar, bonus points: Put a throbber to the left of the button. As an example, see the restrictions dialog when adding a restriction.

!Screen Shot 2014-01-06 at 4.35.06 PM.png!
fields.summary: There is no visual feedback when adding a calendar from popular calendars or searching a calendar
Ability to change the calendar order in the mycalendars screen
If I'm receiving the email notification for a calendar because I'm watching the calendar, it would be nice to have a one-click stop watching.

Admin view to see all calendars, number of subscribers and number of events.
As a user, I would like to add the same event to multiple calendars

Add Event or Calendar to Create Dialog

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-50145].
  {panel}

Hi, 

I'm trying to display all Version release dates on the Jira Calendar.
It seems kinda odd, that if I pick only specific projects in JQL (for example "Project in (A, B, C) then release dates are displayed. 

But if I filter "All Issues" - calendar is empty.

At the end of the day, I want to see all the unreleased versions for all projects
fields.summary: Ability to display versions from all JIRA projects on a calendar
Dynamically adjust the vertical height of the create event dialog

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-50138].
  {panel}

Hi,

Is it possible to consider the ability to add new/modify existing event types within Team Calendars?

Right now it gives you some options, and depending on the type of Calendar, a few more, but what if you wanted to add your own?

Thanks!
fields.summary: Add Ability to Create New Event Type in Team Calendar
Ability to move events from one calendar to another

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-50134].
  {panel}

Hi,
I know that you can import a .ics file and create a new calendar in Team Calendars. I was wondering if it would be possible that after a calendar has been created a second .ics file could be imported to add additional events. 

What I'm thinking is that when you click on the drop down menu for a calendar there could be an option to add additional events from a .ics file.

Since CalDAV is presenting alot of issues, being able to import additional .ics files to a calendar I feel would put out a lot of fires with customers. 

Currently I am creating new calendars on a monthly basis to update one of our calendars (we do this to include all the webex & teleconference data). Any subscribers to the calendars then have to re-subscribe.

I had come across a work around on one of the tickets to create a google calendar and be able to achieve this but since everything in our company is behind a firewall this is not an option.

Having this option would be a great alternative to having a fully synced calendar from outlook via the CalDAV protocol.

Thanks for the time and consideration,
-Aaron
fields.summary: Importing several .ics files into one calendar
Specify a calendar as 'Default' for entering new events
For non-oauthed JIRA servers, there is a non-standard big gap between the "Server" field and the "Display" field - we should make that the normal spacing

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-50131].
  {panel}

I started putting my leave in and realised the event type wasn't leave.
I put in the start and end-date and me... 

So then I changed the event type to leave, and it resets my current values for start and end date

It would be nice to see if we can remember your values if you change event types
fields.summary: Make it easier to keep my data if I start filling out event details and then realise I have the wrong event or calendar type

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-50130].
  {panel}

As a User I want to know Author of calendars that I have subscribed.

*Current*
* We do not provide any feature that allow users know author of calendars.

*Expected:*
* We should provide some things like *calendar properties* that allow Users know detail of calendars

!Screen Shot 2014-04-24 at 9.44.24 AM.png!
fields.summary: As a User I want to know Creator of the calendar

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-50129].
  {panel}

When i am adding similar events into Team Calendars, then i want to have adding dialog left open and partially filled when i submit the form. This functionality should be similar to JIRA "Create another" checkbox in the "Create Issue" dialog.

Description of Done:
* user can check checkbox "add another" before "Ok" button in "Create event" dialog
* user doesn't need to reopen event adding dialog for every date
* user doesn't need to reenter participants and event types
* user can easily define repeating event that re-happens on random dates (e.g. 3.01, 5.02, 8.03, 13.04, 21.05)
fields.summary: Ability to "add another" event to a calendar for adding lots of events quickly
It should be possible to view a list of all the calendars in a Confluence instance that I can subscribe to
See when AND who added a view/edit restriction to a Team Calendar (restriction history / audit log)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-50126].
  {panel}

I'd like to have a team planning functionality like in MS Project 2010:
- As a team manager I can see who is working on which project or who is on vacation, etc. With a week view and a month view
- As a project manager I'd like to see what my project team members (from JIRA project groups) are assigned to do besides the tasks in my project.
- As a Confluence/Team Calendar administrator I'd like to setup my organization's structure in Team Calendar and group people into organization unit (similar to project groups in JIRA).

See also: https://teamweek.com/

I think this is more useful and fits better into JIRA than turning Team Calendar in yet another calendering software like Outlook, Lotus Notes or Google Calendar.
fields.summary: Team Planning functionality

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-50124].
  {panel}

Currently, events occurring on the same day and time are shown overlapping in the week view:
!screenshot005.jpg!

This makes it unreadable and users need to click on each event to see what the event is about. This can be time-consuming when users have a lot of events on the same day/time.

We should be able to improve the way to show these overlapping events. These events can be displayed beneath the other existing events (just like how Google Calendar does it). This behavior can also be seen when there are many events under "All Day".
fields.summary: Improve the way events are displayed in the week view when they occur on the same day & time to avoid overlapping

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-50123].
  {panel}

Hello,

Currently, user is able to export Team Calendar event to iCal format (.ics) to be able to be imported to another calendar. However, customer place a request and would like to receive email notification from Team Calendar in iCal format directly.

Please assess the possibility of implementing it to the Team Calendar plugin.

Thank you and regards,
Lazuardi
fields.summary: Team Calendar email notification in iCal format
In week mode when printing we don't show all hours of the day, we only show you the hours visible on the screen
Ability to control witch event types can be added to a given calendar
You should not be able to try edit the created date of an issue in Team Calendars
Team Calendars should have a Print Feature
When importing a calendar, name field is not actually required, but looks like it should be.
